paper_abstract: The w-Rabin number of a network W is the minimum I so that for any w + 1 distinct nodes s, d(1), d(2),..., d(w) of W, there exist w node-disjoint paths from s to d(1), d(2)....,d(w), respectively, whose maximal length is not greater than 1, where w is not greater than the node connectivity of W. If {d(1), d(2),..., d(w)} is allowed to be a multiset, then the resulting minimum I is called the strong w-Rabin number of W. In this article, we show that both the w-Rabin number and the strong w-Rabin number of a k-dimensional folded hypercube are equal to k/2 for 1 <= w <= k/2 - 1, and k/2 + 1 for k/2 <= 5 w <= k + 1, where k >= 5. Each path obtained is shortest or second shortest. The results of this paper also solve an open problem raised by Liaw and Chang. (C) 2007 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: w-Rabin numbers and strong w-rabin numbers of folded hypercubes
